content.description: Over <math alttext="2,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>,000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> different mutations in the gene encoding dystrophin are associated with different forms of muscular dystrophy. The mutations include deletions of a portion of the gene, duplications of a portion of the gene, and sometimes substitutions of base pairs in certain regions of the gene.
content.question: Which of the following correctly predicts the movement of a mutant allele compared with the movement of the normal allele when analyzed by gel electrophoresis?

choices.label: An allele with base pair substitutions in an exon will travel farther than the normal allele does.
An allele with a duplication in an exon will travel a shorter distance than the normal allele does.
An allele with base pair deletions in an exon will travel the same distance as the normal allele does.
An allele with a duplication in an exon will travel a longer distance than the normal allele does.

content.answer: An allele with a duplication in an exon will travel a shorter distance than the normal allele does.
